org.concordia.kingdoms
Class GameBox

java.lang.Object
  org.concordia.kingdoms.GameBox

public class GameBox
extends Object

Gamebox has all the necessary tokens(tiles,castles..), coins to start the game.

Since:
1.0
Author:
Team K

Constructor Summary
GameBox(Map<TileType,List<Tile>> tiles, Map<CoinType,List<Coin>> coins, Map<Integer,Integer> rankOneCastlesPerPlayer, Map<Integer,Map<Color,List<Castle>>> castles)
           
 
Method Summary
 void assignCastles(Player player, int totalPlayers)
          Each player chooses a color and takes all the rank 2, 3, and 4 castles of his color
 void assignRankOneCastles(Player player, int totalPlayers)
           
 void assignTiles(TileBank tileBank)
          drops all the tiles from gamebox to tilebank
static List<Castle> newCastles(int rank, Color color, int size)
          create 'size' number of new castles with given properties of castle
 void returnCastles(Castle castle)
          Castle will be returned to the gamebox, no null check happens here, so its upto the client code to pass non-null vlues
 void returnTiles(Tile tile)
          Tile will be returned to the gamebox
 List<Coin> takeCoins(CoinType type, int size)
          method allows to take coins from the gamebox, this actaully removes coins from the game box, so make sure you use it appropriately

takeCoins

public List<Coin> takeCoins(CoinType type,
                            int size)
